text:
Sylvan Terrace, east from St. Nicholas Avenue. This is a one block street extend to Roger Morris Park, where the white Jumel Mansion can be seen.

E. P. Chrystie
May 6, 1923
title: Manhattan: Sylvan Terrace - St. Nicholas Avenue

text:
(1) Sylvan Terrace, east side, from St. Nicholas Ave, east to Jumel Terrace. 1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, museum of the City of New York.

(2) Jumel Terrace, West Side and North at Sylvan Terrace. Jumel Terrace, so named for Stephen Jumel who bought the surrounding property in 1810. It is a short street running parallel to Amsterdam Avenue, from 100th Street to 162nd St. On the East side is the old Jumel Mansion and Roger Morris Park, so named after Capt. Roger Morris, who built the house in 1758. October 12th, 1934.
P.L. Sperr.

(3) Sylvan Terrace, looking East to Jumel Mansion. April 27th, 1941.
P.L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Sylvan Terrace - St. Nicholas Avenue
